DESCRIPTION.P: This is a guided interview to procure information to populate the THRC complaint form.

PAGE.NAME: 1-Introduction
PAGE.TEXT: Welcome to the Tennessee Human Rights Commission complaint form! You can use this form to file a complaint if you feel you have been discriminated against.
PAGE.LEARN: Want to know more about the Tennessee Human Rights Commission?

HELP.P: The Tennessee Human Rights Commission is an independent state agency that enforces the Tennessee Human Rights Act.

The Commission works in cooperation with the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development and the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to safeguard individuals from discrimination in employment, housing, public accommodations, and under Title VI of the Civil Rights Act.

PAGE.NAME: Call Spanish Toll-Free Number
PAGE.TEXT: Lamentamos que la entrevista online actualmente no esta disponible en español. Para llegar al formulario de denuncia en español, haga click aquí. Si usted necesita otra ayuda, por favor contacte al Comité de Derechos Humanos de Tennessee al 1-866-856-1252 para hablar en español con una operadora sobre como presentar una denuncia. Gracias.

PAGE.NAME: 1- Disclaimer
PAGE.TEXT:
When you complete this interview, it does NOT mean that your complaint has been filed with the Tennessee Human Rights Commission (THRC).
After you complete this complaint, you must print it out, sign it, and mail or fax it to the THRC.
Click " Yes" if you understand. Click " Exit" if you do not wish to continue.

PAGE.NAME: 2 - Secure Site
PAGE.TEXT:
This is a secure site. Any information transmitted over this site is secure. If you are using a public computer that does not belong to you, remember to completely close out of the internet browser when you are finished. If you don't, you may accidentally share your personal information.
This complaint form may take around 30 minutes to complete.
This form cannot be saved if you do not finish. The time it takes to complete the complaint form may vary depending on the type of complaint you wish to file.

PAGE.NAME: 2-Language
PAGE.TEXT: Do you speak English?

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Speak english
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must choose one option before proceeding

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Speak english
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must choose one option before proceeding

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Speak english]=true
GOTO "3-Next Instructions"
END IF
IF [Speak english]=false
GOTO "2-Language 2"
END IF

TEXT.P: You can file a complaint with the Tennessee Human Rights Commission by completing the questions in this interview. Click "Begin" when you are ready to start.
If you make a mistake at any time, you can click the "Back" button in the top left hand corner of this screen. Do NOT use the back and forward arrows in your browser.
If you need to revisit a question you have already answered, you can use the "MY PROGRESS" drop down menu at the top of your screen.
If you see a "Learn More" button on your screen, click it for extra information that might be helpful!
Some information is required to complete the complaint form. That information will be in RED.
Your guided interview is now complete!

Please print your complaint form, sign it, and date it. You will need to mail it to the address below. Once the Tennessee Human Rights Commission receives your complaint, they will call you. If you do not hear from them in the next ten days, please call 1-800-251-3589.
Tennessee Human Rights Commission Central Office
Tennessee Tower
312 Rosa L. Parks Avenue, 23rd Floor
Nashville, TN 37243
Note: Remember to exit the browser fully to protect your personal information!

PAGE.NAME: 1-Type of Complaint

TEXT.P: Thank you for that information, %%[Client first name TE]%%!

You may file one of four types of complaints. The four types of complaints are:
1) Employment

2) Housing
3) Public Accommodation
4) Title VI
Do you know which type of complaint you would like to file?

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Know type of complaint y or n

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Know type of complaint y or n

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Know type of complaint y or n]=true
GOTO "1a-Housing, PA, or Title VI"
END IF
IF [Know type of complaint y or n]=false
GOTO "1b-About each type of complaint"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 1-Name

TEXT.P: You will now be asked to fill in certain contact information. Please fill out this information as completely and correctly as possible so that the Human Rights Commission can contact you after processing your complaint.
What is your name?
Note: Fields in red are required.

PAGE.LEARN: Why do you need my name?
PAGE.HELP:
The Tennessee Human Rights Commission requires your name to file a complaint. They will contact you to get more information.
Furthermore, anonymous applications are not accepted by the Tennessee Human Rights Commission.

FIELD.LABEL: First:
FIELD.NAME: Client first name TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter your first name to continue.

FIELD.LABEL: Last:
FIELD.NAME: Client last name TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter your last name to continue.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF HASANSWERED([Client middle name TE])
SET [Client name TE] TO [Client first name TE] + " " + [Client middle name TE] + " " + [Client last name TE]
ELSE
SET [Client name TE] TO [Client first name TE] + " " + [Client last name TE]
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2-DOB

TEXT.P: What is your date of birth?
Note: You must be at least 18 years old to file a complaint.

PAGE.LEARN: Why do we need your date of birth?
PAGE.HELP: To ensure that you eligible to file a complaint with the THRC.

PAGE.NAME: 3-Address
PAGE.TEXT: What is your current mailing address?
PAGE.LEARN: Why do you need my address?
PAGE.HELP: We need your address in order to contact you with information about your complaint. If you move or are evicted, you must contact the Tennessee Human Rights Commission so we know where to find you.

FIELD.LABEL: Street Address:
FIELD.NAME: Client address TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must disclose your address in order to process the complaint.

FIELD.LABEL: City:
FIELD.NAME: Client city TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must disclose your full address in order to process the complaint.

FIELD.LABEL: County:
FIELD.NAME: Client county TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must disclose your full address, including county, in order to process your complaint.

FIELD.LABEL: Zipcode
FIELD.NAME: Client zip TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: Your zipcode must be expressed in numbers. If you do not know your zipcode, either ask someone or leave it blank.

PAGE.NAME: 4-Have home phone?
PAGE.TEXT: Do you have a home phone?
PAGE.LEARN: Why do we need your phone number?
PAGE.HELP: We need your phone numbers so that our staff can get in touch with you to discuss your complaint.
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Have home phone]=true
GOTO "5-Telephone"
END IF
IF [Have home phone]=false
GOTO "6-Have cell phone?"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 5-Telephone
PAGE.TEXT:
What is your home phone number?
NOTE: Please format telephone numbers like this: XXX-XXXX.
PAGE.HELP: No worries, %%[Client first name TE]%%, click continue to enter your cell phone number.

FIELD.LABEL: Area code:
FIELD.NAME: Client area code TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter an area code.

FIELD.LABEL: Number:
FIELD.NAME: Client phone number TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must include a dash after the first three numbers and before the last four numbers.

PAGE.NAME: 7-Cell Phone
PAGE.TEXT: What is your cell phone number?
PAGE.HELP: If you do not have a home or cell phone number, be sure to include a number where you can be reached through an alternative contact. If you do not have an alternative contact, please be sure to include an email address. If you do not have an email address, open a new window and create an email address so that we have at least one way to contact you.

FIELD.LABEL: Area code:
FIELD.NAME: Client cell area code TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must include an area code.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell phone number:
FIELD.NAME: Client cell number TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must include a dash after the first three numbers--before the last four number--of your cell phone number.

PAGE.NAME: 6-Have cell phone?
PAGE.TEXT: Do you have a cell phone?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Cell phone TF]=true
GOTO "7-Cell Phone"
END IF
IF [Cell phone TF]=false
GOTO "8-Have an email address?"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 8-Have an email address?
PAGE.TEXT: Do you have an email address?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Email yes or no]=true
GOTO "9-Email address"
END IF
IF [Email yes or no]=false
GOTO "10-Alternate contact?"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 9-Email address
PAGE.TEXT: Enter your email address.

PAGE.NAME: 10-Alternate contact?
PAGE.TEXT: In case we have trouble reaching you, is there someone else we can contact?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Alternate contact]=true
GOTO "11-Alternate contact name"
END IF
IF [Alternate contact]=false
GOTO "1-Type of Complaint"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 11-Alternate contact name
PAGE.TEXT: What is the name of your alternate contact?

FIELD.LABEL: First:
FIELD.NAME: alternate contact first name
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter a first name.

FIELD.LABEL: Last
FIELD.NAME: alternate contact last name
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter a last name.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF HASANSWERED([alternate contact middle name])
SET [Contact name TE] TO [alternate contact first name] + " " + [alternate contact middle name] + " " + [alternate contact last name]
ELSE
SET [Contact name TE] TO [alternate contact first name] + " " + [alternate contact last name]
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 12-Alternate contact address
PAGE.TEXT: What is your alternate contacts address?

PAGE.NAME: 1- Narrative

TEXT.P:
In your own words, tell us what happened. Please make the basis of your discrimination clear.
Please give dates if you know them and include the names of anyone that was present. Be sure to tell us why you feel you were treated differently based on your membership in a protected class.

For Housing complaints, the protected classes are race, creed, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability or familial status, or if you feel you were retaliated against. Also, if you’re filing a housing complaint and are currently facing eviction, let us know here.
For Title VI complaints, the protected classes are race, color, or national origin.
For Public Accommodation complaints, the classes are...
You must tell us your story before you can continue.

PAGE.LEARN: Not sure what your basis of discrimination is?
PAGE.HELP: Your basis of discrimination is the REASON you were discriminated against. It will include your race, creed, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability or familial status, or if you feel you were retaliated against.

PAGE.NAME: 1- Discriminated against?
PAGE.TEXT: Do you believe you have been the victim of discrimination?

HELP.P: It depends on which type of complaint you file, but generally, a " discriminatory practice" is any direct or indirect act or practice of exclusion, distinction, restriction, segregation, limitation, refusal, denial, or any other act or practice of differentiation or preference in the treatment of a person or persons because of race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, age, familial status or national origin.

In other words, if you were excluded, treated differently, or refused or denied service because of your race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, age, familial status or national origin then you may be the victim of a discriminatory practice.
For example:
1) Landlords cannot charge more rent because you have children or prohibit service animals if you are disabled.
2) Restaurants and other establishments open to the public, and is used by the general public, cannot refuse you service due to your race, creed, national origin, or religion.
3) A federally funded business or agency cannot treat your differently or refuse you service based on your race, color, or national origin.
If you have questions regarding your eligibility to file a complaint, you may call the Tennessee Human Rights Commission directly at: (615) 741-5825.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Victim of discrimination]=true
GOTO "2-Discriminated against in Tennessee?"
END IF
IF [Victim of discrimination]=false
GOTO "You do not qualify"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: You do not qualify
PAGE.TEXT:
If you were not excluded, treated differently, or refused or denied service by a person or business because of your race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, age, or national origin then you do not qualify as a complainant.
If you have further questions, please contact the Tennessee Human Rights Commission at (615) 741-5825 or toll-free at 1-800-251-3589. You may also contact your local Legal Aid Office for information about your situation.
If you have reached this page by mistake, press the "Back" button in the top left corner of your screen.

PAGE.NAME: You do not qualify 2
PAGE.TEXT:
If you do not have a Housing, Public Accommodation, or Title VI claim, you do not qualify to use the online interview.
If you have an Employment claim, please contact the Tennessee Human Rights Commission at (615) 741-5825 or toll-free at 1-800-251-3589.
If you have made a mistake, use the "Back" button at the top left corner of your screen.

PAGE.NAME: 2-Discriminated against in Tennessee?
PAGE.TEXT: Did the discriminatory act or practice occur in Tennessee?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [occur in TN]=true
GOTO "3-Ready to file?"
END IF
IF [occur in TN]=false
GOTO "Act must have occurred in TN."
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 3-Ready to file?
PAGE.TEXT: Are you ready to file your complaint?
PAGE.LEARN: Want to know what information you will need?
PAGE.HELP: To fill out the form, you will need to share your personal contact information and the name and address of the person, business, or entity that discriminated against you. You will also need to know the date(s) of the discriminatory act.

PAGE.NAME: Act must have occurred in TN.
PAGE.TEXT:
I'm sorry. You cannot file a complaint with the Tennessee Human Rights Commission if the discriminatory act or practice did not occur in Tennessee.
In order to file a complaint, contact the Human Rights Commission for the state in which the discriminatory act or practice occurred.
For example, if the act occurred in Georgia, contact the Civil and Human Rights Commission of Georgia.

PAGE.NAME: 1a-Housing, PA, or Title VI
PAGE.TEXT: What type of complaint would you like to file?
PAGE.LEARN: Need more information about the types of complaints?

HELP.P: You may have an Employment complaint if someone refused to hire you, paid you less than others, or fired you based on your race, creed, color, religion, sex, age, or national origin. If you have an employment complaint, please contact the Tennessee Human Rights Commission at 1-800-251-3589.

You may have a Housing complaint if someone refused to sell or rent property, charged you a different amount of rent than someone else, or refused to allow modification or accommodations based on your race, creed, color, religion, national origin, age, familial status, or disability.
You may have a Public Accommodation complaint if you were discriminated against in a place that is open to, and is used by the general public, due to your race, creed, national origin, or religion.
You may have a Title VI complaint if you were discriminated against because of your race, color, or national origin (where your ancestors are from), and the person or business that discriminated against you was a state agency, or a person affiliated with a state agency, that receives money from the Federal Government for the program or activity with which you are involved.
If you would like to see the information about and specific examples of each type of complaint again, you will need to use the "BACK" button located in the top left corner of this interview window.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Type of Complaint MC]="Housing"
GOTO "1h-General Disclaimer About Bases of Discrim for Housing"
END IF
IF [Type of Complaint MC]="PA"
GOTO "3-Public Accommodation-1"
END IF
IF [Type of Complaint MC]="Title VI"
GOTO "1j-General Disclaimer About Bases of Discrim for Title VI"
END IF
IF [Type of Complaint MC]="Employment"
GOTO "Employment Complaint"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 4c-Title VI: Type of Discrimination
PAGE.TEXT: We are going to ask you a few more questions about the discrimination you experienced.

PAGE.NAME: 4d-Title VI: Type of Discrimination
PAGE.TEXT: Did someone deny you a service, aid, or benefit?
PAGE.LEARN: Not sure? Click here for an example.
PAGE.HELP: For example: You were not given food stamps because of your race.

PAGE.NAME: 4e-Title VI: Type of Discrimination
PAGE.TEXT: Were you treated differently from others when you were receiving a benefit or service?
PAGE.LEARN: Not sure? Click here for an example.
PAGE.HELP: For example, you were the last to receive the benefit or service because of your race, color, or national origin.

PAGE.NAME: 4f-Title VI: Type of Discrimination
PAGE.TEXT: Were you separated or segregated from others because of your race, color, or national origin in receiving a benefit or service?
PAGE.LEARN: Not sure? Click here for an example.
PAGE.HELP: For example: You are a prison inmate, and you were forced to eat separately from other inmates because of your race, color, or national origin.

PAGE.NAME: 4g-Title VI: Type of Discrimination
PAGE.TEXT: Were you denied membership on a planning or advisory body?
PAGE.LEARN: Not sure? Click here to learn more.
PAGE.HELP: For example: A state agency has a committee that advises it on policy. You were not allowed to serve on that committee because of your race.

PAGE.NAME: 4h-Title VI: Type of Discrimination
PAGE.TEXT: Was the discrimination against you different from one of the examples given?
PAGE.LEARN: Not sure? Click here to learn more.
PAGE.HELP: Discrimination can happen in many different forms. If your experience was different from one of the examples given, click yes.
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Other title actions TF]=true
GOTO "4i-Title VI: Type of Discrimination"
END IF
IF [Other title actions TF]=false
GOTO "4j-Title VI: Retaliation"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 4i-Title VI: Type of Discrimination
PAGE.TEXT: In a short sentence, tell us how the discrimination you experienced was different.

PAGE.NAME: 4j-Title VI: Retaliation
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against?
PAGE.HELP: If you were treated differently because previously you filed a discrimination complaint you may have been retaliated against.
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Retaliation title basis TF]=true
GOTO "4k-Title VI: Retaliation"
END IF
IF [Retaliation title basis TF]=false
GOTO "4m-Title VI: Respondent Info"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 4k-Title VI: Retaliation
PAGE.TEXT: Why were you retaliated against?
PAGE.LEARN: Don't see the reason you were retaliated against?
PAGE.HELP: Select " Other" and tell us how you were retaliated against in the next question.

FIELD.LABEL: Gave testimony or participated in a discrimination investigation
FIELD.NAME: Gave testimony title TF

PAGE.NAME: 4l-Title VI: Retaliation 2
PAGE.TEXT: If you selected " Other", please tell us more. If not, select " Continue"

PAGE.NAME: 2a-Housing: Basis of Discrim Race
PAGE.TEXT: Do you believe you were discriminated against because of your race?

HELP.P: A person's "race" can be defined as those obvious, physical traits such as the color of their skin. Some examples include the African-American, Caucasian, and Hispanic races.

P.I: An example of discrimination on the basis of race: If a landlord refused to rent to you because you are African-American, Caucasian, Hispanic, or another race.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination race TF]=true
GOTO "2a-Housing: Basis of Discrim Race 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination race TF]=false
GOTO "2b-Housing: Basis of Discrim Color"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2b-Housing: Basis of Discrim Color
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of the color of your skin?
PAGE.LEARN: To learn more about discrimination on the basis of "Color," click "Learn More."
PAGE.HELP:
Color here refers to your skin color.
Example: If someone denied you entrance to a grocery store because you are "brown-skinned."
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination color TF]=true
GOTO "2b-Housing: Basis of Discrim Color 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination color TF]=false
GOTO "2c-Housing: Basis of Discrim National Origin"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2c-Housing: Basis of Discrim National Origin
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of your national origin?

HELP.P: National origin means the country you or your ancestors are from.

P.I: An example of discrimination based on national origin:
If a landlord refused to rent to you because your family migrated from another country.

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination national origin TF

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination national origin TF

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination national origin TF]=true
GOTO "2c-Housing: Basis of Discrim National Origin 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination national origin TF]=false
GOTO "2d-Housing: Basis of Discrim Disability"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2d-Housing: Basis of Discrim Disability
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of a mental or physical impairment that limits your life activities?
PAGE.LEARN: Need more information about "disabilities" or "life activities"?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination disability TF]=true
GOTO "2d-Housing: Basis of Discrim Disability 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination disability TF]=false
GOTO "2e-Housing: Basis of Discrim Sex"
END IF
PAGE.NOTES: Grounds for Disability taken from TCA 4-21-102 and HUD's website.

PAGE.NAME: 2e-Housing: Basis of Discrim Sex
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of your sex/gender?
PAGE.HELP:
Sex/Gender generally refers to the designation of male or female as indicated on your birth certificate, driver's license, or another form on file with the Federal Government.
Example: If someone refused to rent to you, or would only rent to you on different terms, because you are a woman.

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination sex or gender TF

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination sex or gender TF

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination sex or gender TF]=true
GOTO "2e-Housing: Basis of Discrim Sex 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination sex or gender TF]=false
GOTO "2f-Housing: Basis of Discrim Religion"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2f-Housing: Basis of Discrim Religion
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of your religion?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination religion TF]=true
GOTO "2f-Housing: Basis of Discrim Religion 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination religion TF]=false
GOTO "2g-Housing: Basis of Discrim Creed"
END IF
PAGE.NOTES: We didn't feel that a definition of religion was necessary. If they don't know what religion is, it's unlikely to be the reason why they filed this complaint today.

PAGE.NAME: 2g-Housing: Basis of Discrim Creed
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of your creed?
PAGE.HELP: Creed is a deeply held belief.
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination creed TF]=true
GOTO "2g-Housing: Basis of Discrim Creed 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination creed TF]=false
GOTO "2gg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Familial Status"
END IF
PAGE.NOTES:
This was Shay's answer to your (Professor Vojdik's) question about what creed is. There is not a working definition of creed and a lot of confusion about what would constitute a protected "creed" in TN and most other states. While it seems synonymous with religion, only one state has held that the two are synonymous. As a result, it's hard to provide an example.
This site gives an interesting rundown on the ambiguity of "creed": http://hrprofessionalsmagazine.com/creed-t-human-rights-act/

PAGE.NAME: 2gg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Familial Status

TEXT.P: Do you feel you were treated differently because you are pregnant, have children, or have custody of a child under 18?
Reminder: This is the last basis of discrimination for a housing complaint. If you have not checked one, you will not be able to file a complaint.

PAGE.HELP:
Familial status means a family contains a member under the age of 18.
In accordance with the THRA, it is discrimination if someone treats you differently with regard to the terms and conditions of housing due to the presence of children or the expected presence of children under the age of 18, including pregnant women. Please note it is illegal to advertise “no children” in advertisements for the sale or rental of housing.

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination familial status TF

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination familial status TF

PAGE.NOTES:
Definition of "familial status" taken directly from THRC's website.
https://www.tn.gov/humanrights/search?keywords=housing

PAGE.NAME: 2ggg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Retaliation

TEXT.P: Do you feel you were treated differently by a person or business because you:
1) previously filed a discrimination complaint against,
2) gave testimony against, or
3) took part in an investigation against:
- The person or business or
- A friend, family member, or employee of the person or business?

HELP.P: If you were treated differently due to previously filing a discrimination complaint, giving testimony against, or taking part in an investigation against the person you seek to file a discrimination action against today, you may have been retaliated against.

This means that the person who discriminated against you did not like something you did in response to their discriminatory act, so they took action (eviction, raising rent, etc.) that harmed you in some way in order to seek revenge or get even, which is also known as retaliation.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Basis of discrimination retaliation TF]=true
GOTO "2gggg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Retaliation 2"
END IF
IF [Basis of discrimination retaliation TF]=false
GOTO "2h-Housing: Who discriminated against you?"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2gggg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Retaliation 2
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against because you filed a complaint of discrimination against a person or business?

PAGE.NAME: 2ggggg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Retaliation 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against because you gave testimony or took part in an investigation against a person or business?

PAGE.NAME: 2gggggg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Retaliation 2 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against because you protested against or criticized discrimination by a person or business?

PAGE.NAME: 2ggggggg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Retaliation 2 2 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Was there another, different basis for the retaliation?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Type of retaliation other TF]=true
GOTO "2ggggggg-Housing: Basis of Discrim Retaliation 2 2 2 2 2"
END IF
IF [Type of retaliation other TF]=false
GOTO "2h-Housing: Who discriminated against you?"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2h-Housing: Who discriminated against you?
PAGE.TEXT: Who discriminated against you? Was it a person or a business?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Housing discrim person or business]=true
GOTO "2hh-Housing: Person discriminated"
END IF
IF [Housing discrim person or business]=false
GOTO "2hh-Housing: Person discriminated 2"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2hh-Housing: Person discriminated
PAGE.TEXT: What is the person's name?
PAGE.HELP: You don't need to know the person's name at this moment, but it would be helpful if you could find and let the commission know.

PAGE.NAME: 2hhhh-Housing: Address 1
PAGE.TEXT: What is the address of the person or business that discriminated against you?

PAGE.NAME: 2hhhh-Housing: Phone
PAGE.TEXT: What is the phone number of the person or business that discriminated against you?
PAGE.HELP: If you don't know the phone number we can look it up later.

PAGE.NAME: 4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 2: Color
PAGE.TEXT: Do you believe you were discriminated against because of the color of your skin?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Color title basis TF]=true
GOTO "4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 2a: Color"
END IF
IF [Color title basis TF]=false
GOTO "4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 3"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 3
PAGE.TEXT: Do you believe you were discriminated against because of your national origin?

HELP.P: National origin means the country you or your ancestors are from.
An example of discrimination based on national origin:
If a landlord refused to rent to you because your family migrated from another country.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [National origin title basis TF]=true
GOTO "4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 3a: National Origin"
END IF
IF [National origin title basis TF]=false
GOTO "4c-Title VI: Type of Discrimination"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 1: Race
PAGE.TEXT: Do you believe you were discriminated against because of your race?

HELP.P: Race is membership in a distinct group based on physical and genetic features. Some examples include the African-American, Caucasian, and Hispanic races.
An example of discrimination on the basis of race:
If a landlord refused to rent to you or a bank refused to provide lending to you for the purchase of a home because you are African-American, Caucasian, Hispanic, or another race.

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Race title basis TF]=true
GOTO "4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 1a: Race"
END IF
IF [Race title basis TF]=false
GOTO "4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 2: Color"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 1a: Race
PAGE.TEXT: What is your race?

PAGE.NAME: 4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 2a: Color
PAGE.TEXT: What is your skin color?

PAGE.NAME: 4-Title VI: Basis of Discrimination 3a: National Origin
PAGE.TEXT: What is your national origin?

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-1
PAGE.TEXT: When did the discrimination happen?
PAGE.HELP: When did this business discriminate against you?

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-2
PAGE.TEXT: When were you last discriminated against ? Please give us the most recent date of discrimination against you.

FIELD.LABEL: Date of Most Recent Discriminatory Act
FIELD.NAME: Most recent date DA

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-4
PAGE.TEXT: Do you believe you were discriminated against because of your race?
PAGE.HELP: A person's "race" can be defined as those obvious, physical traits such as the color of their skin.

FIELD.LABEL: If YES, Please indicate your race.
FIELD.NAME: Race pa basis TE

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-3
PAGE.TEXT:
There are several reasons a business might discriminate against you. Here are the reasons prohibited by the Tennessee Human Rights Commission:
Reasons for Public Accommodation Discrimination:
Race
Color: The color of your skin
National Origin: The country that you or your ancestors are from
Age: How old you are
Sex/Gender: Whether you are male or female
Religion
Creed: A non-religious but sincerely held belief
Retaliation: Being punished for engaging in a legally protected activity, such as filing a discrimination complaint, or assisting in a complaint.

BUTTON.NEXT: 1i-General Disclaimer About Bases of Discrim for PA
BUTTON.LABEL: Continue

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-5

TEXT.P: Do you feel you were treated differently because of the color of your skin?

PAGE.HELP: Color here refers to your skin color. For example, you might say you were denied entrance to a grocery store because you are "brown-skinned."

FIELD.LABEL: If Yes, what is your color?
FIELD.NAME: Color pa basis TE

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-6
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of your national origin?
PAGE.HELP: National Origin is based on the country that you or your ancestors are from. For example, a person from Japan is Japanese. Also, a person whose parents are from Japan might also be considered Japanese.

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination national origin TF

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Basis of discrimination national origin TF

FIELD.LABEL: If YES, what is you National Origin?
FIELD.NAME: National origin pa basis TE

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-16
PAGE.TEXT: Who discriminated against you? Was it a business (this can include any person who worked for the business)?
PAGE.HELP: An example of a business that may have discriminated against you might be a local restaurant chain or a department store.
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Pa discrim person or business]=true
GOTO "3-Public Accommodation-17"
END IF
IF [Pa discrim person or business]=false
GOTO "3-Public Accommodation-18"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-18
PAGE.TEXT: What was the business's name?

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-7
PAGE.TEXT: Do you believe that you were discriminated against because of your age?
PAGE.HELP: Your age is how old you are, in years.

FIELD.LABEL: If YES, then how old are you?
FIELD.NAME: Age pa basis NU

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-8
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of the sex or gender indicated on your birth certificate?
PAGE.HELP:
Sex and gender, for the purposes of this form, refer to what is indicated on your birth certificate.
For example, discrimination based on sex or gender would be a situation in which a dry cleaning service charged women more than men for the same services.

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-9
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of your religion?
PAGE.HELP: Discrimination based on religion could occur, for example, if a sales person in a store treated a Jewish person differently than Christians.

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-10
PAGE.TEXT: Do you feel you were treated differently because of your creed?
PAGE.HELP: " Creed" is deeply held belief.

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-1a
PAGE.TEXT: Is the discrimination ongoing?
PAGE.HELP: Is the business still discriminating against you?

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-11
PAGE.TEXT:
RETALIATION
Do you believe that you were treated differently by a business for your involvement in a discrimination claim?
The Human Right Commission offers three possible reasons for retaliation:
1. You filed a complaint against a company
2. You gave testimony or participated in a discrimination investigation involving someone else
3. You opposed a discriminatory act
You may also have a different reason than stated above.
Do you think retaliation is why you were treated unfairly or differently?
PAGE.HELP: For example, Karen filed a complaint with the Commission against her local grocery store. Days later, she again visited the store, where she received poorer service from the store's clerks compared to the other customers. This could be the grocery store retaliating against Karen.
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Retaliation pa basis TF]=true
GOTO "3-Public Accommodation-12"
END IF
IF [Retaliation pa basis TF]=false
GOTO "3-Public Accommodation-16"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-12
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against because you filed a complaint of discrimination?
PAGE.HELP: For example, Mark filed a discrimination complaint against his local butcher shop. A week later, he went to visit the same butcher, and the shop owner refused to serve him.

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-13
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against because you gave testimony against someone or took part in an investigation about discrimination?
PAGE.HELP: For example, Adam's co-worker filed a discrimination claim against their employer. Adam testified on his co-worker's behalf about the discrimination that had occurred. After learning about Adam's involvement in the discrimination claim, Adam's manager assigned Adam longer shifts for the next month. This could be retaliation.

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Gave testimony investigation pa basis TF

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Gave testimony investigation pa basis TF

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-14
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against because you opposed or were against an act of discrimination?
PAGE.HELP: For example, Janet overheard her boss saying that he would refuse to let anyone over the age of 40 into their store. Janet told her boss that what he was planning to do was wrong, and that she wouldn't be involved in it. Days later, Janet was fired. This could be retaliation against Janet because she opposed a discriminatory act.

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-15
PAGE.TEXT: Is there another reason that you believe you are being retaliated against? (You can include all the details of the situation in the "What Happened" section of this interview).

PAGE.NAME: 2hhhhh-Housing: Type of person or business
PAGE.TEXT: Was the person or business that discriminated against you one or more of the following? You may check all that apply, and you MUST select one to continue.

FIELD.LABEL: Bank or Lender
FIELD.NAME: Respondent info bank or other lender TF

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Respondent info other TF]=true
GOTO "2hhhhh-Housing: Type of person or business OTHER"
END IF
IF [Respondent info NOA]=true
GOTO "Respondent Type--Must Respond"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2hhhhhhh-Housing: Property Address
PAGE.TEXT: What is the street address of the house or property involved in the discrimination?

PAGE.NAME: 2hhhhhh-Housing: Type of property involved
PAGE.TEXT: What type of property was involved in the discrimination?

FIELD.LABEL: House or building for two or more families
FIELD.NAME: Property Type MC
FIELD.VALUE: House or building for two or more families

FIELD.LABEL: Building for five or more families
FIELD.NAME: Property Type MC
FIELD.VALUE: Building for five or more families

PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Property Type MC]="Single family house"
GOTO "2hhhhhhh-Housing: Property Address"
END IF
IF [Property Type MC]="House or building for two or more families"
GOTO "2hhhhhhh-Housing: Property Address"
END IF
IF [Property Type MC]="Building for five or more families"
GOTO "2hhhhhhh-Housing: Property Address"
END IF
IF [Property Type MC]="Other"
GOTO "2hhhhhh-Housing: Type of property involved 2"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2i-Housing: Sale or rent
PAGE.TEXT: Was the property for sale or rent?

PAGE.NAME: 2ii-Housing: Owner live
PAGE.TEXT: Did the owner live at the property?

PAGE.NAME: 2iii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt
PAGE.TEXT: You are going to be asked a few questions about the discrimination. Please mark yes or no depending on what happened.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4
PAGE.TEXT: Did someone intimidate, coerce, or interfere with you?
PAGE.HELP: You may have been coerced if someone used physical force or threatened to harm you to persuade you to do something.
PAGE.NOTES: We used what Professor Vojdik provides in her notes.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 2
PAGE.TEXT: Did someone refuse to sell, rent, or negotiate with you?

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Did someone falsely deny you housing that was available?
PAGE.LEARN: What does mean to "falsely deny" housing?
PAGE.HELP:
Someone may have falsely denied you housing if they refused to sell or rent to you and gave you a reason that was false.
Example: if the landlord told you that the property was unavailable to rent, or that it was not safe for someone to live in, or some other false statement.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2

TEXT.P: Were the terms and conditions of your sale or rental different from another person(s) of a different race, color, national origin, religion, creed, sex, disability, age, family status, or as a result of retaliation?”

PAGE.LEARN: How can I tell if my terms and conditions differed from others?
PAGE.HELP:
You will know if you were given different terms and conditions in your rental or purchase of housing if this was an action taken against you.
If you live in a building that houses more than one family, you may have either heard from someone in the building who doesn't belong to a protected class about their terms and conditions of rental, lease, or purchase.
If you live in a single family home, you may have heard from someone who doesn't belong to a protected class who received better terms and conditions on a loan despite using the same bank or lender. Or if you're renting a single family home from the same landlord as someone else, you might have heard that their terms and conditions are better.
A more common example is if you were asked to pay a higher price (be it rent or purchase price) than others not belonging to a protected class, despite the properties being the same.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Were you retaliated against?
PAGE.LEARN: How would I know if I was retaliated against?

HELP.P: You cannot be punished for (a) filing a claim against, or (b) for giving information during an investigation about:

PAGE.NOTES: We quoted this directly from Prof. Vojdik's suggested text.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Was there discrimination in the financing of your home, home loan, or other financing terms relating to housing?
PAGE.LEARN: How would I know if I was financially discriminated against?
PAGE.HELP: For example, financial discrimination might occur if you received a higher interest rate, or were denied financing because of a discriminatory reason, such as your race or sex.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2 2 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Was there advertising which was discriminatory?
PAGE.LEARN: How can I tell if an advertisement is discriminatory?
PAGE.HELP:
Advertisements cannot state or suggest that the property does not allow children or service animals or that a building or complex is only available to persons of a certain race.
Example: photographs of an apartment building that only show white tenants could suggest that tenants must be white.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiiiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2 2 2 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Was there discrimination in real estate services?
PAGE.LEARN: How do I know what real estate discrimination is?
PAGE.HELP: Real estate agents cannot direct you to a certain area of town based on the racial make-up of the area or imply that property values or crime rates are changing because of the people who live there.

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiiiiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2 2 2 2 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Did someone refuse to allow modification of the property or otherwise accommodate your disabilities?
PAGE.LEARN: Not sure what "refusal to modify for or accommodate disabilities" means?
PAGE.HELP: Property owners must allow you to modify your home if you agree to pay for the reasonable modifications and for the home to be returned to its previous condition when you move out. Any changes must not physically damage the property.

FIELD.LABEL: Yes
FIELD.NAME: Refusal to modify or accommodate TF

FIELD.LABEL: No
FIELD.NAME: Refusal to modify or accommodate TF

PAGE.NAME: 2iiiiiiiiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2 2 2 2 2 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Was there another type of discriminatory action taken against you?
PAGE.CODEAFTER:
IF [Other actions against you TF]=true
GOTO "2iiiiiiiiiiiii-Housing: actions taken agaisnt 4 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2"
END IF
IF [Other actions against you TF]=false
GOTO "2j-Housing: When did the discrimination happen"
END IF

PAGE.NAME: 2j-Housing: When did the discrimination happen
PAGE.TEXT: When did the discrimination begin?

PAGE.NAME: 2jj-Housing: When did the discrimination happen 2
PAGE.TEXT: What is the most recent date in which you suffered this discrimination?
PAGE.LEARN: Are you unsure of the most recent date?
PAGE.HELP: If you are unsure of the precise date, just give a ballpark estimate of the most recent date of discrimination.

PAGE.NAME: 2jjj-Housing: When did the discrimination happen 2 2
PAGE.TEXT: Is the person or business still discriminating against you?

PAGE.NAME: 1b-About each type of complaint
PAGE.TEXT:
Here is some more information about each type of complaint:
You may have a Housing complaint if someone refused to sell or rent property, charged you a different amount of rent than someone else, or refused to allow modification or accommodations to the property to accommodate a disability on the basis of race, color, national origin, disability, sex/gender, religion, creed, familial status, or in retaliation against you for filing a complaint of discrimination, giving testimony or otherwise participating in a discrimination investigation, opposing or objecting to discrimination, or another means of retaliation.
The Tennessee Human Rights Act prohibits discrimination related to housing, residential or commercial, including Advertisement, Financing, Negotiating, Rental, Real Estate Transaction and Sale. The law applies to Associations, Builders, Brokers, Developers, Insurance Agents, Financial Institutions, Landlords, Managers, Operators and Owner.
You may have a Public Accommodation complaint if you were discriminated against in a place that is open to, and is used by the general public, due to your race, creed, national origin, or religion.
You may have a Title VI complaint if you were discriminated against because of your race, color, or national origin (where your ancestors are from), and the person or business that discriminated against you was a state agency, or a person affiliated with a state agency, that receives money from the Federal Government for the program or activity with which you are involved.
Do you need additional information about each type of complaint, or are you ready to file?
PAGE.LEARN: Want to see some examples of each type of discrimination?
PAGE.HELP:
For housing, finance companies cannot charge you a higher interest rate because of your religion. Landlords cannot refuse to rent to you because you have children. Realtors cannot steer you toward an area of town because of your race.
For Title VI, any state agency that receives federal funding cannot discriminate against you because of your race, color, or national origin. If a state agency that is receiving federal funding denies you a benefit, or treats you differently then everyone else, AND that treatment is based on your race, color, or national origin, you may have a Title VI complaint.

PAGE.NAME: 1c-About housing in-depth

TEXT.P:
Here is more information and examples of each type of complaint:
Housing discrimination comes in many different forms. Federal law makes it illegal to discriminate in the provision of housing based on a person's race, color, national origin, religion, sex, family status, or disability.
If you have been discriminated against in one of the following ways (among others), and on one of the bases listed above, you should file a housing complaint:
- If someone refused to sell, rent or lease housing to an interested tenant or buyer.
- If someone applied different sale, rental or occupancy terms for different people.
- If someone lied about or misrepresented the availability of housing when housing was in fact available.
- If someone provided inferior conditions, terms, facilities or privileges in connection with housing.
- If someone “blockbusted” or encouraged people to leave an area based on their protected class.
- If someone refused to permit reasonable modifications when accommodations may have been necessary for a person to use and enjoy their dwelling.
- Steering customers to a certain neighborhood, refusing to serve certain customers by real estate professionals.
- If someone redlined or limited financial lending in a particular area because of the demographics of that area, or imposed different terms or conditions on a loan.
- If someone harassed tenants and homeowners in connection with housing accommodations.
- If local zoning laws have an unfair effect on protected classes.

These examples are NOT all-inclusive. You may have been discriminated against in another sense. Even if you do not recognize your specific situation in the examples above, you may continue with the interview.

P.B: To learn more about OTHER types of discrimination, press "Continue."

PAGE.HELP: A protected class is a characteristic of a person which cannot be targeted for discrimination, including race, color, religion, national origin, sex/gender, family status, or disability.

BUTTON.LABEL: Continue to Information About Public Accommodation

PAGE.NAME: 1d-About PA in-depth
PAGE.TEXT:
Under Tennessee law, a public accommodation is a place or service that is generally open and available to the public, and can be run by the government, or a private company.
It is an illegal practice for a place of public accommodation to discriminate against anyone based on any of the following:
- Age (40+)
- Color
- Creed
- National Origin
- Race
- Religion
- Sex
Examples of a public accommodation could include your local grocery stores and schools, to law offices and even dentists.
The law also prohibits publishing, circulating, or displaying any material that communicates that any person is unwelcome on the basis of unlawful discrimination.
If you were a victim of this type of discrimination, you should file a public accommodation complaint.
To learn about TITLE VI discrimination, press "Continue."

BUTTON.LABEL: Continue to Information About Title VI

TEXT.P: Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 prohibits discrimination based on race, color, or national origin in programs or activities receiving money from the federal government. All federal agencies that provide grants of assistance (money to support businesses/other entities) are required to enforce Title VI.
For example, the U.S. Department of Education gives grants of financial assistance to schools and colleges and to certain other entities, including vocational rehabilitation programs.
Examples of discrimination covered by Title VI include:
- Discriminatory Bullying or harassment
- School segregation
- Denial of language services to English learners
- Denial of equal rights to public education regardless of immigration/citizenship status
- Discriminatory assignment to special education services
- Intimidating, threatening, coercing, or discriminating against any individual for the purpose of interfering with any right or privilege otherwise secured by federal law

PAGE.NAME: 1f-Type of complaint round 2
PAGE.TEXT:
Now that you've heard a little more about each type of complaint, are you ready to select which type of complaint you need to file?
If you would like to review the information again, use the "BACK" button located in the top left corner of this interview window.

PAGE.NAME: 1g-Contact Legal Aid or THRC
PAGE.TEXT:
If you are still unsure which type of complaint to file, you may want to speak with your local legal aid office or contact the Tennessee Human Rights Commission directly. You can call them at 1-800-251-3589.
If you explain your situation to an attorney at your local legal aid office, he/she can probably explain which type of complaint you need to file. Otherwise, a representative for the Tennessee Human Rights Commission may also be able to assist you in figuring out which type of complaint you need to file.
Unfortunately, however, if you do not know which type of complaint you need to file, you will not be able to complete the guided interview.
If you have reached this page by mistake, press the "BACK" button in the top left corner of your screen to try again.
If you are truly unsure of which type of complaint to file, press the "Exit Interview" button below this box and fill out the complaint once you have the necessary information.

PAGE.NAME: 3b-Please return when you are ready to file
PAGE.TEXT:
In that case, please return when you are ready to file.
If you have reach this page by mistake, press the "BACK" button located in the top left corner of your screen.
If you are truly not ready to file a complaint, press "Exit Interview" below.

PAGE.NAME: 3a-Why not?
PAGE.TEXT: Do you need more information about each type of complaint?

BUTTON.NEXT: 3b-Please return when you are ready to file
BUTTON.LABEL: No

PAGE.NAME: 1-Witness Name 1
PAGE.TEXT: You will now be asked to fill in certain contact information for your witnesses. Please fill out this information as completely and correctly as possible so that the Human Rights Commission can contact you after processing your complaint. What is your witness's name?

FIELD.LABEL: First:
FIELD.NAME: Witness first name TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter a valid name to continue.

FIELD.LABEL: Last:
FIELD.NAME: Witness last name TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter a valid name to continue.

PAGE.NAME: 2-Witness Address 1
PAGE.TEXT: What is the address of your witness?
PAGE.LEARN: Why do you need an address?
PAGE.HELP: We need an address in order to contact your witness about your complaint.

FIELD.LABEL: Street address:
FIELD.NAME: Witness address TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must disclose your address in order to process the complaint.

FIELD.LABEL: Apartment Number (If needed)
FIELD.NAME: Witness apt number TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must disclose your full address in order to process the complaint.

FIELD.LABEL: City
FIELD.NAME: Witness address city TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must disclose your full address, including city, in order to process your complaint.

PAGE.NAME: 3-Witness Phone 1
PAGE.TEXT: What is your witness's phone number?
PAGE.LEARN: Why do you need this information?
PAGE.HELP: The Commission may need to speak with one of your witnesses regarding your claim.

FIELD.LABEL: Area code:
FIELD.NAME: Witness phone area code TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must enter an area code.

FIELD.LABEL: Number:
FIELD.NAME: Witness phone number TE
FIELD.INVALIDPROMPT: You must include a dash after the first three numbers and before the last four numbers.

PAGE.NAME: 1-Witness Intro
PAGE.TEXT: Do you have any witnesses?

PAGE.NAME: 4-Witness Last Question
PAGE.TEXT: Do you have any more witnesses?

PAGE.NAME: 2hh-Housing: Person discriminated 2
PAGE.TEXT: What is the name of the business?

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-19
PAGE.TEXT: What is the address of the business that discriminated against you?

PAGE.NAME: 3-Public Accommodation-20
PAGE.TEXT: What is the phone number of the business that discriminated against you?

PAGE.NAME: 4m-Title VI: Respondent Info
PAGE.TEXT: What is the name of the state agency that discriminated against you?
PAGE.LEARN: Not sure what a state agency is?

HELP.P: An example of a state agency is The Department of Corrections.
The discrimination does not have to come from the agency directly.

The discrimination could also come from an organization that received funding from a state agency. You can tell us about that organization instead if you are not sure which agency funded the organization. If you are unsure, you may skip the question.

PAGE.NAME: Employment Complaint
PAGE.TEXT:
You may not file an employment complaint using this interview at this time.
If you need to file an employment complaint, please contact the Tennessee Human Rights Commission directly at (615) 741-5825 or toll-free at 1-800-251-3589.You may also access the online complaint form here.

PAGE.NAME: 1h-General Disclaimer About Bases of Discrim for Housing
PAGE.TEXT:
Before you begin your complaint, however, it is CRITICAL for you to understand that you MUST select AT LEAST ONE basis of discrimination.
If you do not select a basis of discrimination, your complaint cannot be filed. Even if you complete the interview and follow the instructions for filing a complaint, the Tennessee Human Rights Commission WILL NOT accept your complaint if you have not selected a basis for discrimination.
Furthermore, it is rare that you will have a cause of action for EVERY type of discrimination. Please read the "Learn More" prompts and think very carefully about the bases of discrimination which you select.
Selecting all of the bases may delay the process of filing and taking action to resolve your complaint.
Please keep this in mind as you progress through the bases of discrimination. Thank you.

PAGE.NAME: 1i-General Disclaimer About Bases of Discrim for PA
PAGE.TEXT:
Before you answer the basis of discrimination questions, it is CRITICAL for you to understand that you MUST select AT LEAST ONE basis of discrimination.
If you do not select a basis of discrimination, your complaint cannot be filed. Even if you complete the interview and follow the instructions for filing a complaint, the Tennessee Human Rights Commission WILL NOT accept your complaint if you have not selected a basis for discrimination.
Furthermore, it is incredibly rare that you will have a cause of action for EVERY type of discrimination. Please read the "Learn More" prompts and think very carefully about the bases of discrimination which you select.
Selecting all of the bases may delay the process of filing and taking action to resolve your complaint.
Please keep this in mind as you progress through the bases of discrimination. Thank you.

PAGE.NAME: 1j-General Disclaimer About Bases of Discrim for Title VI
PAGE.TEXT:
Thank you, %%[Client first name TE]%%!
Before you begin your complaint, however, it is CRITICAL for you to understand that you MUST select AT LEAST ONE basis of discrimination.
If you do not select a basis of discrimination, your complaint cannot be filed. Even if you complete the interview and follow the instructions for filing a complaint, the Tennessee Human Rights Commission WILL NOT accept your complaint if you have not selected a basis for discrimination.
Furthermore, it is rare that you will have a cause of action for EVERY type of discrimination. Please read the "Learn More" prompts and think very carefully about the bases of discrimination which you select.
Selecting all of the bases may delay the process of filing and taking action to resolve your complaint.
Please keep this in mind as you progress through the bases of discrimination. Thank you.

PAGE.NAME: Speaks Chinese
PAGE.TEXT:
我很抱歉，目前还没有一个中国的投诉表格，也没有任何人与谁讲中国的佣金。
您可以尝试直接在（615） 741-5825，或免费电话 1-800-251-3589 联系人权委员会。

PAGE.NAME: Speaks German
PAGE.TEXT: Bitte enschuldigen Sie, dass im Moment keine deutschen Versionen des Online-Interviews oder des Beschwärdeformulars zur Verfügung stehen. Bitte kontaktieren Sie, The Tennessee Human Rights Commission, direkt über (615) 741-5825 oder gebührenfrei über 1-800-251-3589 um mit einem Vertreter, über ihr Anliegen, zu sprechen. Vielen Dank.

PAGE.NAME: Speaks French
PAGE.TEXT:
Je suis désolé. Ni entretiens ni formulaires de plaintes sont actuellement disponibles en français.
Pour plus d'informations et d'aides afin de déposer une plainte, veuillez contacter la commission nationale consultative des droits de l'homme directement au (615) 741-5825 ou gratuitement au 1-800-251-3589.

PAGE.NAME: Respondent Type--Must Respond
PAGE.TEXT: You must select at least one respondent type. Please press the "BACK" button at the top left corner of your screen to make a selection.

PAGE.NAME: 2hhhhh-Housing: Type of person or business OTHER

PAGE.TEXT: My popup text

If you do not know, please select no.
